instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: SSD Repairs
threads.message:
I have a 256GB SSD from a liquid damaged <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, have repaired the MLB but the SSD will not mount, I was going to chuck it but noticed a few blown components and so thought about trying a repair.

Does anyone have any nfo on this? So far have not been able to find any schematics so don't know what the values of the blown parts should be, which maybe the end of the road.

Its a Samsung MZ-JPV2560/0A4

threads.title: SSD Repairs
threads.message: If they really need data recovery, you best bet would be to buy a identical ssd and swap components from the good one to the bad
